title: Internal and Executive Communications Associate Director
content:
About Generate:Biomedicines
Generate:Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company – existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine – pioneering Generative Biology™ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. The Company has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.
We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!
Generate:Biomedicines was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received nearly $700 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Somerville and Andover, Massachusetts with over 275 employees.
The Role: 
The Internal and Executive Communications Associate Director will be responsible for supporting the development and execution of internal and external executive communications for the company in order to inform, inspire, and engage. Internally, the ideal candidate is passionate about shaping the employee communication experience and is energized by working in an agile, startup environment. This individual serves as the communications lead, curator, and strategist, bringing together stakeholder groups to align on purpose driven communications and campaigns that keep employees engaged and informed. This includes writing clear and exceptional communications, business update presentations, and talking points. Additionally, this expert communicator will provide strategic direction in elevating our executives externally by designing and implementing an executive communication strategy, and in doing so, serve as a connector / storyteller to raise awareness of the organization's mission and vision and strengthen our external reputation. This role will report to the Head of Corporate Affairs and will be a key partner to relative stakeholder groups, including People & Culture.  
Here's how you will contribute:
 

Responsible for defining and executing internal communications strategies and serving as the primary contact, bridging enterprise-wide partner functions to ensure consistency, clarity, and alignment in messaging.  
Ensure timely and thoughtful dissemination of communications to ensure awareness of key decisions and relevant updates. 
Manage end-to-end programming of internal meetings, including agenda curation, presentation building, and finding external thought leaders for internal speaking opportunities.  
Partner with People & Culture to ensure cross-functional alignment on key employee engagement and talent acquisition activities.  
Lead the development and continual improvement of internal communications mechanisms to ensure relevant companywide content, tone of voice, and access to important company information is accessible to all. 
Executing end-to-end executive storytelling efforts that support business objectives, including executive positioning, corporate reputation, and company culture and values. 
Elevate our executives externally, including sourcing and supporting an external speaking strategy, crafting and submitting relevant individual and company awards, and identifying additional opportunities for thought leadership. 

The Ideal Candidate will have:
 

8+ years of pharmaceutical or biotech communications experience from a PR agency or corporate setting. 
Comprehensive understanding of the company core business and corporate-level strategies and objectives, activities and communications.  
Expert writing and message development skills with an ability to write and adapt to various styles, formats, and audiences. 
Extensive communications design experience and advanced presentation development skills. 
Proven ability to develop and implement communication strategies in collaboration with a diverse team. 
Proven ability to provide strategic communications counsel to executives, orchestrating high-visibility executive presentations, and enhancing corporate reputation.  
Experience in engaging high-performance teams and developing innovative communication platforms. 
Ability to design and implement innovative communication efforts that engage and inspire others at various levels in the organization. 

#LI-HM1
Generate:Biomedicines is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
COVID Safety:
Generate:Biomedicines enforces a mandatory vaccination policy for COVID-19. All employees must be fully vaccinated and have received a booster.  The purpose of this policy is to safeguard the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large from infectious disease that may be reduced by vaccinations.  The Company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable.
Recruitment & Staffing Agencies: Generate:Biomedicines does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to Generate:Biomedicines or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Generate:Biomedicines’s internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of Generate:Biomedicines, and The Company will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.
